최대 4시간이 지난 후에 브라우저 툴바에 있는 AdGuard 아이콘을 통해 `필터 업데이트 확인...`을 클릭하여 다운로드하실 수 있습니다.

</details>

comment.body:
> Mentioned url not blocked for me
Apparently it doesn't work only when I'm visiting the page on Chrome 110.0.5481.65 (Pixel 5 TQ1A.221205.011). It's fine if I turn off HTTPS Filtering or use a different browser like Firefox Focus.

> you posted a blocking rule and not an unblocking rule
That rule is generated by AdGuard app when I tapped "Unblock" in the filters log.

comment.body:
The rule is added via the "Unblock" button in the Filters log. I didn't create a blocking rule. The rule is generated by AdGuard when I tapped "Unblock".

I don't know the format of the rules but if AdGuard created a blocking rule instead of an unblocking rule then there is another issue with the UI.

I attached more screenshots showing this specific entry in AdGuard's filters log. Again, this only occurs with Chrome/Brave + HTTPS Filtering on. If I use Firefox Focus, it will load fine even with HTTPS Filtering turned on.

![Screenshot_20230218-174028](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/42469039/219853590-321e13ae-7064-4096-95f6-2a3f77c2cf94.png)

![Screenshot_20230218-174040](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/42469039/219853592-d424eaa9-cba6-4905-be8c-29d29386b73f.png)

![Screenshot_20230218-174239](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/42469039/219853593-bdd704f2-1210-4a2f-9a87-a2c8ceea73bf.png)

In this screenshot below it shows the same entry but it's in "Allowed" state after adding that rule.

![Screenshot_20230218-175132](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/42469039/219854012-f9d735e8-1deb-413d-844a-d41ec974ef7e.png)

Only after adding this rule that the website can load properly on both Chrome and Brave. One thing I noticed is that, without this rule, the website seems to flash the content for a split second before going blank again.

Other ad blocker

Desktop

AdGuard Base filter, AdGuard German filter, AdGuard Tracking Protection filter, EasyList, EasyList Germany, EasyPrivacy

_No response_

 https://github.com/easylist/easylistgermany/issues/250#issuecomment-1428437004

This issue has been automatically marked as stale because it has been open for 4 days with no activity.
Unfortunately, our resources are limited and we can not always take the time to respond to requests about websites that are not popular enough. The issue will be closed if no further activity occurs.
Please note, that AdGuard Filters is an open-source project that is used by different content blockers and we welcome contributions. If you have some technical knowledge about how websites work, you are welcome to create a pull request following [these instructions](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md).

comment.body:
This issue has been automatically marked as stale because it has been open for 4 days with no activity.
Unfortunately, our resources are limited and we can not always take the time to respond to requests about websites that are not popular enough. The issue will be closed if no further activity occurs.
Please note, that AdGuard Filters is an open-source project that is used by different content blockers and we welcome contributions. If you have some technical knowledge about how websites work, you are welcome to create a pull request following [these instructions](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md).

This issue has been automatically marked as stale because it has been open for 4 days with no activity.
Unfortunately, our resources are limited and we can not always take the time to respond to requests about websites that are not popular enough. The issue will be closed if no further activity occurs.
Please note, that AdGuard Filters is an open-source project that is used by different content blockers and we welcome contributions. If you have some technical knowledge about how websites work, you are welcome to create a pull request following [these instructions](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md).

issue.body:
### Prerequisites

- [X] Filters were updated before reproducing an issue;
- [X] AdGuard product version is up-to-date;
- [X] Browser version is up-to-date;
- [X] If the site or app is broken, disabling AdGuard protection resolves an issue.

### What product do you use?

Other ad blocker

### AdGuard version

1.46.1rc0

### What type of problem have you encountered?

Missed ads or ad leftovers

### Which browser(s) do you use?

Firefox

### Which device do you use?

Desktop

### Where is the problem encountered?

https://www.pornohirsch.net/

### What filters do you have enabled?

AdGuard Base filter, AdGuard German filter, AdGuard Tracking Protection filter, EasyList, EasyList Germany, EasyPrivacy

### What Stealth Mode options do you have enabled?

_No response_

### Add your comment and screenshots

1. https://github.com/easylist/easylist/issues/14954#issuecomment-1427779014
 https://github.com/easylist/easylistgermany/issues/250#issuecomment-1428437004
https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/issues/81081

A reason why to hide at least the bottom big ad placeholder is already provided: "annoying, taking space", thus it should be fixed, otherwise a counter-argumentation why not to fix it should be provided, "no because no"/ "ignoring" is insufficient explanation.


3. Screenshots
<details><summary>Screenshot 1:</summary>

<!-- paste screenshot here -->
![](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/72945564/218305818-e29c9bb9-7f0d-4e5e-ad2d-d148356e8a2a.png)

</details>

### Privacy

- [X] I agree to follow this condition

comment.body: The websites are popular enought, most of them have between several hundrends thousands and several millions of monthly visitors, the ads have been fixed already in the past: https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/issues/81081, it's time to fix these annoying ad placeholders.
